summary:
Material Information Summary

Quarterly Report (Appendix 4C Equivalent)

  • Cash Balance (30 June 2025): A$11.4 million (no debt).
  • Key Holdings: ~13 million shares in Green Technology Metals (ASX: GT1), valued at ~A$391k.
  • Shares Outstanding: 62,517,506.
  • Exploration Focus:
  • Pickle Lake Gold Project (Ontario, Canada): Eastern Hub prioritized (road-accessible targets: South Limb, 250 North, West Pickle, Kasagiminnis).
  • Kasagiminnis Deposit: JORC Inferred Resource of 790,000t @ 4.3g/t Au (110,000oz).
  • Western Hub (Dorothy, Dobie) deprioritized due to high-cost helicopter access.
  • Cash Burn:
  • Operating costs: A$279k (staff + admin).
  • Exploration spend: A$29k.

No Material Catalysts Identified

  • No raising, M&A, or significant asset updates beyond exploration prioritization.

Format: Ultra-concise, filtered for trading/capital decisions. Omitted operational details without near-term financial impact.

• Related Party Transaction: Raptis Group enters a Facilitation Agreement with Patmos Development Holdings (related party) to source debt/equity funding for the Sterling Residences Broadbeach development.
  • Fee Structure: Potential commission fee of up to AUD 16 million ($200k per unit settled), payable post-repayment/refinance of facility, contingent on project completion and unit sales.
  • Timing: Income recognition expected from FY2026 onwards, subject to project completion (anticipated May 2026) and unit settlements.
  • Shareholder Approval: Pending ratification via general meeting per ASX Listing Rule 10.1 due to related party nature and material fee size.

No material information identified for trading or capital markets decisions.

(This is a routine director's interest disclosure with no impact on valuation, liquidity, or capital structure.)

Quarterly Activities Report (Q2 2025) – PVW Resources Limited

Material Information for Trading/Capital Markets Decisions

Key Exploration & Operational Highlights

  • Capão Bonito REE Project (Brazil):
  • Peak grades of 5,662 ppm TREO (total rare earth oxides) from shallow, near-surface intercepts (up to 17m thick).
  • Metallurgical testwork indicates Ionic Adsorption Clay (IAC)-style mineralisation with 89% MREO recovery in select intervals (e.g., 10m @ 89% recovery).

  • Phase 1 drilling completed (51 holes); assays confirm consistent high-grade REE mineralisation (e.g., 14m @ 2,440 ppm TREO).

  • Portfolio Rationalisation:

  • Três Córregos tenement relinquished due to sub-500 ppm TREO grades.

  • Focus shifted to higher-priority targets (Capão Bonito, Sguario, Carambeí, Cerro Azul).

  • Upcoming Catalysts (H2 2025):

  • Resource definition studies at Capão Bonito.
  • Drilling campaigns at Sguario (22 holes) and Carambeí (12 holes).
  • Metallurgical optimisation for scalable IAC processing.

Corporate & Financial Updates

  • Cash Position (Appendix 5B):
  • Closing cash balance: $110k (down from $646k last quarter).
  • Quarterly exploration expenditure: $320k; total FY25 expenditure: $857k.

  • Funding runway: 0.2 quarters – Company is actively exploring capital-raising or asset divestments (e.g., non-core Australian gold projects).

  • Related-Party Payments:

  • $100k paid (director fees, accounting services, rent).

Strategic Outlook

  • Prioritising Brazilian REE projects (IAC potential).
  • Reviewing options for Australian gold assets (Leonora, Kalgoorlie).

Bottom Line: Positive exploration results at Capão Bonito de-risk the project, but liquidity concerns (limited cash runway) may prompt near-term capital actions.

• Announcement Type: Board Appointment (Subsidiary)
  • Material Information:
  • Appointment of Dr. Joseph Mkandawire (ex-Malawi Mining Ministry Principal Secretary) to Board of subsidiary Globe Metals & Mining Africa.
  • Strategic focus: Government relations and policy alignment for Kanyika Niobium Project development.
  • Enhances regulatory/development capabilities but no immediate financial or operational impact.

No material trading or capital markets implications identified.

No material information identified.

(Note: Director's interest notices are routine disclosures that typically do not contain trade-sensitive or capital markets-relevant information unless they indicate substantial changes in holdings. This filing shows no material changes.)

Summary of ASX Announcement (Form 603 - Notice of Initial Substantial Shareholder)

  • Announcement Type: Substantial Shareholder Notice (BlackRock Group)
  • Key Details:
  • Total Voting Power: BlackRock Group now holds a 5.02% stake in Downer EDI Ltd (ASX: DOW).
  • Nature of Interest: Control over voting/disposal rights via subsidiaries acting as investment managers or trustees.
  • Securities Acquired: Multiple on-market purchases (AUD range: $5.16–$6.92 per share) and in-specie transfers between March–July 2025.
  • Relevant Agreements: Securities lending agreements disclosed (e.g., BlackRock Advisors Limited with counterparts like Bank of Nova Scotia, Barclays, etc.).

Material Impact:
1. Increased Institutional Ownership: BlackRock’s 5%+ stake signals significant institutional interest, potentially affecting liquidity and share price stability.
2. Voting Rights: Collateral agreements restrict voting unless instructed by borrowers (minimal immediate impact).

Note: No capital raising, trading halt, or operational updates.

Conciseness: Omitted boilerplate, legal terms, and non-material subsidiary details. Focused on ownership change and implications.
